alert.note: Alert for Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 12:22PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Elko County through 1245 PM PDT... At 1222 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Fork, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Elko County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
